channel.title: Astronomy fact of the Day
channel.description: RSS feed of the astronomy fact of the day.

item.title: Tetrad (astronomy)
item.description: In astronomy, a tetrad is a set of four total lunar eclipses within two consecutive years. The frequency of tetrads varies by century with the frequency of total lunar eclipses. This repeating cycle is called a tetradia. See Eclipse cycle for more information.
